channel.title: Cheat Codes
channel.description: Where do you put in the Cheat Codes at.Are there any Cheat Codes out there for this game.Did the Developers include them.

item.title: Cheat Codes
item.dc:creator: Avalokitesvara
item.description:
maxximo:

The source engine as himself have 3 universal codes/cheats (for all source engine games):
first, in steam, put the properties, launch options and put “-console”, without “”
when you start the game you gonna see a console, dont close, start a new game, or load a game, press escape, and in the console write “sv_Cheats 1” and then put the cheats:

God: godmode
Noclip: Ghost mode
Impulse 101: all weapons

the rest are more for development (like npc create, wireframe, etc…

Maybe this statement is not true, DOTA2 is a Source engine game developed by Valve and i pretty sure that al least Noclip and Impulse 101 won’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat Codes
item.dc:creator: Mabilis
item.description:
rmlife2:

thanks you but he puts me: attemted to create unknown entinty type ncp_tatatata

The message says it is an unknown entity. It is correct, ncp_tatatata is an unknown entity. Don’t use ncp - that is not a prefix for any entity I am aware of. ‘npc’ is, use that instead.

For example: npc_headcrab is a real entity (A headcrab npc). Try that first.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat Codes
item.dc:creator: elivance
item.description:
Sorry today I’m a bit lazy ,hence I’ll quote myself:

Hi!

I’ve heard that this topic is quite popular so I figure out a way to show you how would be the tentacle in the mine field.

I did it using this cheat: npc_create npc_tentacle.

Generally, you can’t spawn a npc that does not exists as an entity in that map
but for some reason, Devs forgot to remove it, hence you can spawn it.

How to spawn it:
1- sv_cheats 1
2- npc_create npc_tentacle
the map of the mine field is bm_c2a5b.

In order to do it, you must enable the dev console.
the list of npcs

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat Codes
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
You can deactivate noclip simply by retyping it in the console. If you want to deactivate cheats entirely then ‘sv_cheats 0’ is the command you’re looking for.

item.title: Cheat Codes
item.dc:creator: wilsonpa
item.description:
yeoldhippy:

Where do you put in the Cheat Codes at.Are there any Cheat Codes out there for this game.Did the Developers include them.

Input of cheat codes is the same as Half Life ie via the console. However, some are the same (eg impulse 101 and sv_infinite_aux_power 1) and others do not work (eg give item_ammo_357). If anyone has an updated list, I would be grateful.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat Codes
item.dc:creator: eligitine
item.description:
One thing to remember when having cheats enabled is that on games that have Achievements enabling the cheats will cause Achievements to get disabled, you know a kind of anti-cheat which prevents you from cheating to get Achievements.

Actually, with Black Mesa, they don’t get disabled at all, which is strange.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat Codes

item.title: Cheat Codes
item.dc:creator: eligitine
item.description:
Quick summary of the avalible useful everyday commands for black mesa.

NOTE: The vast majorty of these require “sv_cheats 1” to be enabled.

god | Prevents you from taking any damage or knockback what so ever. You can still die by falling into scripted death triggers, like jumping off of bottomless pits.

buddha | Allows you to take damage, but you will never fall below 1 hitpoint. Very rarely you will die with this code. Does not require cheats.

noclip | Enables “fly” mode, where you can clip through walls and other obstacles. Be aware that you can still trigger map triggers, such as tripmines and scripted sequences.

impulse 101 | Gives you all weapons, maxes out reserve and secondary ammunition, and gives you one health kit and battery.

notarget | Prevents AI from targeting you, AI characters will still move around.

ai_disable | Turns off AI completely, this can cause strange things to happen.

give | A very flexible command, able to give a large quantity of items.

ent_create | Similar to give, but will create the object where your cursor is pointing.

Examples
give item_healthkit | Gives the player a health kit worth 25 health.
give item_battery | Gives the player a battery worth 15 armor.
give weapon_shotgun | Gives the player a shotgun.
give item_ammo_357 | Gives the player a pickup of .357 magnum ammo.
give item_longjump | Gives the player the long jump module.

Type dumpentityfactories to show everything you can give/spawn.
NOTE: Not all of these things can or should be spawned. If it doesn’t look familiar, don’t spawn it!

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat Codes
item.dc:creator: Gideaninja
item.description:
Jenova19:

If that doesn’t work, try this:

  1. Close Black Mesa.
  2. Open Steam.
  3. Browse to the Library (All Games).
  4. Right click “Black Mesa”.
  5. Click “Properties” (on the bottom of the menu).
  6. Click “Set Launch Options…”.
  7. Type “-console” (without “”).
  8. Click “OK”.
  9. Close the “Black Mesa - Properties” window.
  10. Start the game.

Note: Adding “-dev” (without “”) to the Launch Options enables
“sv_cheats” (it is set to 1) and some more in-game information (in the top left corner of the screen), as well.

thx! this made more sense, then adding it to my desktop shortcut

Read full topic
